Class MovementHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • MovementHandler

  • public class MovementHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is to handle all the logical component behind the game, changing the rock color, determining the direction of the frog, and display the result of a round
    Author:
    jia

    • Method Detail

      • buttonClicked

        public void buttonClicked(int i)
        Called by the GamePanel if a click on the button "start" is detected
        Parameters:
        i - is the index of the start rock/Sign(green) on the LinkedList of Signs

      • setlocOnList

        public void setlocOnList(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - set the location of the current Signs object(rock) on the LinkedList; this data is from the caller class GamePanel

      • getNextButton

        public Signs getNextButton()
        determine the location of the next button on the SignList according to the identifier (the actual location in a the matrix described in decimal; e.g. 1.2 means row 1 col 2) of each Sign object in the LinkedList of Signs
        Returns:
        return the reference of the next sign on the list; if not exist, the frog is "in water" or at the end rock(red)

      • directionDeterminator

        public void directionDeterminator()
        Determine the direction the frog should face ; update its next rock information; and update the rock image to be darker(stepped on)

      • setDefault

        public static void setDefault()
        restore all values to default values

      • getMovementImage

        public java.awt.Image getMovementImage()
        Returns:
        the image of the frog

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Parameters:
        g2d - used to draw the image of the frog on current location

      • checkS

        public boolean checkS()
        Returns:
        if all the rocks are stepped on when the frog is at the end rock(red)

      • delay

        public void delay()
        delay the appearance of the frog image to be seen
